task.title: Solids Revolve
task.shortdesc: REVOLVE command revolves a 2D object to the specified certain angle to form solids. The revolving axis can be X, Y axis of current UCS as well as lines, polylines.

context.p: Similar to EXTRUDE, the REVOLVE command easily helps drawing the details of a drawing that is hard to implement by the common outline.

To revolve the objects that are lines or arcs intersect with polylines, you can use Join option of PEDIT command to convert theminto multiple single polyline objects, and then perform REVOLVE command. Objects can be revolved are closed polylines, polygons, rectangles, circles, ellipses, regions and so on. On the contrary, the objects can't be revolved are 3D objects, objects that are included in a block, polylines with intersections and transections or unclosed polylines.

step.cmd: Choose Draw > Solids > Revolve from the mainmenu.
Do one of the following to define the axis of revolution:
Specify a start point and an endpoint.
Type o and press Enter to select anobject that determines the axis.
Type x and press Enter to select the x-axis.
Type y and press Enter to select the y-axis.

result.p: Left: Select the object to revolve (A) and the axis (B) about which to revolve it, followed by the angle of revolution Right: The resulting revolved solid
